SEARCH
Package textui.element

Class TextElement

java.lang.Object
textui.element.Element
textui.element.TextElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
SortedListElement, UnsortedListElement
public class TextElement extends Element
Represents a text-based UI element that displays formatted paragraphs of text. This class extends Element and manages text content organized as a list of paragraphs, where each paragraph is a list of words. It supports text alignment (left, right, center) and word casing options. TextElement does not support child elements and overrides insertChild methods to prevent adding sub-elements. The class is responsible for rendering the text content within its allocated area, respecting padding, margin, borders, and alignment settings.

  • Field Details

    • paragraph

      protected List<List<String>> paragraph
      Stores the text content of the element as a list of paragraphs, where each paragraph is represented as a list of words (strings). Each inner List represents one line or paragraph broken down into words, allowing flexible text processing like alignment or wrapping.

    • setText

      public TextElement setText(String text)
      Sets the text content of this TextElement, applying the configured word casing and wrapping words into lines according to the element's width and height constraints.

      The method processes the input text by splitting it into words and transforming each word according to the wordCase setting, which can be NORMAL, TITLE, UPPERCASE, LOWERCASE, or NOEDIT. It then arranges these words into lines that fit within the available width, respecting padding, margin, and border sizes.

      If the width or height of the element is not yet set, it will calculate and set these values based on the text length and configured minimum and maximum dimensions.

      Parameters:
      text - the string text content to set; if empty or blank, the method returns immediately
      Returns:
      this TextElement instance for method chaining

    • setTextAlign

      public TextElement setTextAlign(TextAlign textAlign)
      Sets the text alignment for this TextElement.
      Parameters:
      textAlign - the desired text alignment (e.g., LEFT, RIGHT, CENTER)
      Returns:
      this TextElement instance for method chaining

    • setWordCase

      public TextElement setWordCase(Case wordCase) throws ValueCannotBeSetException
      Sets the casing style for the words in this TextElement.

      This method must be called before any text is set. If text has already been added (i.e., the paragraph is not empty), it throws a ValueCannotBeSetException.

      Parameters:
      wordCase - the case style to apply to words (e.g., NORMAL, TITLE, UPPERCASE)
      Returns:
      this TextElement instance for method chaining
      Throws:
      ValueCannotBeSetException - if called after text content has been set

    • getWordCase

      public Case getWordCase()
      Returns the current word case style used in this TextElement.
      Returns:
      the word case style (e.g., NORMAL, TITLE, UPPERCASE)

    • getTextAlign

      public TextAlign getTextAlign()
      Returns the current text alignment of this TextElement.
      Returns:
      the text alignment (e.g., LEFT, RIGHT, CENTER)

    • printScreen

      public TextElement printScreen()
      Renders the current text element onto the screen buffer, applying border and alignment. Resets the screen before printing, then adds borders. Depending on the text alignment setting, adjusts horizontal positioning: - LEFT: prints rows starting at the left edge. - RIGHT: prints rows right-aligned within the available width. - CENTER: prints rows centered within the available width.
      Overrides:
      printScreen in class Element
      Returns:
      this TextElement instance for chaining.
